descriptions.description: 🚗 Brazil’s license plates were plain white till 2018. Now they rock a white plate with a blue stripe on top. Red ones? For working rides only. You got this?
🔵 Blue stripe on white plates = Brazil. Red plates mean busy vehicles. Remember or forget?
🚘 White plates got a glow-up with a blue stripe. Red ones? Hustler’s badge. You keep or toss this?
🇧🇷 Brazil talks Portuguese, not Spanish. It’s -ão, not -ón, and -nh, not ñ. You got this or nah?
🗣️ In Brazil, it’s -ão instead of -ón. They say -ch, not -ll. Portuguese rules here. You remember this?
🌍 Most of Latin America speaks Spanish. Brazil? Portuguese, with its cool -ão and -nh endings. Stuck in your head?
🪜 See a pole that looks like a ladder? That’s Brazil’s style. You got it?
📏 Tall, rectangle poles with holes and ladder vibes = Brazil. Cool or nah? You’ll remember?
descriptions.no: Poles all look the same to me.

descriptions.description: 👀 Ladder poles are a classic in Brazil. Spot them down low. You’ll notice?
⚫ Most Brazilian road signs got black painted backs. Not the usual, huh? You see this or nah?
🛑 Back of signs = black in Brazil. Weird flex? Remember or forget?
🚧 Sign backs painted black is Brazil’s thing. You keep this detail?
🔵 Blue road markers with numbers and kilometres show up on Brazil’s roadsides. You spot those or nah?
🛣️ Blue signs with road numbers and kms are a Brazil thing. Remember this detail?
🚦 Blue markers on road edges with numbers? That’s Brazil. Keep or toss?
⬛ Brazil uses yellow on black chevrons — opposite to most South America who do black on yellow. You see the difference?
⚠️ Yellow on black chevrons are Brazil’s style. Weird flip, right? Remember this?
🚧 Brazil’s chevrons = yellow on black, not black on yellow like others. You keep or toss?
🛣️ Roads in Brazil usually have double yellow lines in the middle and white lines outside. Sometimes just a single dashed yellow. You got this?
🚧 Double yellow lines = Brazil roads. White on the edges. Single dashed sometimes too. Remember this?
🟡 Yellow lines in pairs are Brazil’s road thing. White edges outside. You keep or toss this?
⚪ White painted kerbs show up a lot on Brazilian roads. You noticed that?
🛣️ White kerbs are common in Brazil. Remember this detail?
🚧 White painted kerbs are Brazil’s thing. Keep or toss?
🏠 Lots of Brazilian houses have orange tiled roofs. You got this roof style down?
🏡 Orange roof tiles are a Brazil classic. Remember this or nah?
🧱 Orange tiles on roofs? Brazilian vibe. Keep or toss?
📡 Transparent satellite dishes are pretty common in Brazil — kinda unique in Latin America. You noticed this?
🛰️ Clear satellite dishes? Brazil’s thing, not usual in Latin America. Remember this?
📶 Transparent dishes on roofs are Brazilian style. Keep or toss?
💧 Blue Fortlev water tanks often chill on roofs in Brazil. You spotted those?
🏠 Blue water tanks on roofs? Brazil classic. Remember this?
🚰 Blue Fortlev tanks = Brazilian rooftop thing. Keep or toss?
